name: Unitree
description: Hangzhou-based manufacturer of quadruped and humanoid robots, founded in 2016 by Wang Xingxing. Shipped over 5,500 humanoid robots in 2025 and targets 20,000 units in 2026. Product lineup spans consumer quadrupeds (Go2), industrial platforms (B2, H2), and affordable humanoids (G1, R1).

name: Deep Robotics
description: Global leader in embodied AI robotics, founded in 2017 in Hangzhou. Develops quadrupeds (Lite3, X20, X30), humanoids (DR01, DR02), and wheel-legged platforms (Lynx M20). Secured $70M Series C in December 2025 and planning a 2026 IPO. Won CES 2026 Innovation Award for Lynx M20 Pro.

name: UBTech
description: Shenzhen-based global leader in humanoid robotics and AI education, listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange since December 2023. Walker S2 industrial humanoid entered mass production in 2025 with orders exceeding 800 million yuan. Targets 5,000 units annual capacity by 2026.

name: Boston Dynamics
description: Pioneer in advanced robotics with 30+ years of innovation (Hyundai subsidiary since 2020). Atlas production humanoid unveiled at CES 2026 with 56 DOF and 50kg lift capacity, deploying to Hyundai RMAC and Google DeepMind. Spot quadruped remains industry-leading for inspection and mapping.

name: ANYbotics
description: Swiss robotics company specializing in autonomous inspection quadrupeds. ANYmal D (IP67) and ANYmal X (ATEX Zone 1 explosion-proof, launching 2026). 200+ units shipped, thousands of inspections weekly. €127M Series C (late 2025), $150M+ total raised. Yokogawa partnership for oil/gas. 200+ employees.

name: Ghost Robotics
description: Quadrupedal UGV maker for defense and industrial applications. Acquired by South Korean LIG Nex1 for $240M (July 2024). Vision 60 (51kg, IP67) deployed with U.S. Army, Marines, Air Force, and Japan GSDF. New 6-DOF manipulator arm (Dec 2025). Patent settlement with Boston Dynamics.

name: UniX AI
description: Embodied intelligent robotics company founded in 2024 in Suzhou, China. Wanda 2.0 wheeled humanoid at 100 units/month production, hundreds deployed across hotels, retail, and security. New Panther platform and UniFlex imitation learning framework. $14M raised.

name: Rainbow Robotics
description: Samsung subsidiary (35% stake, $180M, Feb 2025) specializing in advanced humanoid robotics. Founded 2011 by KAIST researchers. New RB-Y1 dual-arm mobile manipulator at $80K. Part of Korean M.AX Alliance ($525M gov investment). HUBO2 deployed at MIT and Google.

name: EngineAI
description: Shenzhen-based robotics company founded in October 2023 by Zhao Tongyang, specializing in general-purpose humanoid robots with full-stack technology. Produced 6 robot models in 16 months including the T800 ($25K) debuted at CES 2026. Product lineup spans affordable bipedals (SA01, PM01), full-size humanoids (SE01, T800), and a quadruped (JS01).

name: Galaxea AI
description: Beijing-based embodied intelligence company founded in 2023. R1 series wheeled humanoids with 26 DOF and NVIDIA Jetson Orin. G0 Plus VLA model (Jan 2026) trained on 500+ hours of real-world data. $144M Series B (Feb 2026) at $1.4B valuation, ~$400M total raised.

name: Booster Robotics
description: Founded in June 2023 by Tsinghua University graduates, Booster Robotics develops humanoid platforms now shipping globally. T1 full-scale humanoid and K1 ($5,999) compact platform. RoboCup world champions (IEEE-RAS Humanoids). $27.9M raised including $13.9M Series A (June 2025). NVIDIA partnership.

name: Tesla
description: Automotive and energy company mass-producing Optimus Gen 3 humanoid robots at Fremont factory (internal deployment). 50 actuators per hand for unprecedented dexterity. Target $30K for limited external sales in late 2026, long-term goal under $20K. Leveraging Tesla AI and battery expertise for humanoid scale.

name: Figure AI
description: California startup building deployable humanoids for industrial and home markets. Figure 02 deployed at BMW factories, Figure 03 ($20K home robot) announced for late 2026. Helix 02 AI for full-body autonomy released Jan 2026. BotQ manufacturing facility planned. Backed by Jeff Bezos, Microsoft, OpenAI, NVIDIA, and Intel with $2.6B+ valuation.

name: Agility Robotics
description: Commercializes bipedal robots for logistics and warehouse automation. Digit has moved 100K+ totes at GXO Logistics and secured Toyota contract for 7 units (Feb 2026). $400M Series C raised. RoboFab manufacturing facility capable of 10,000 units/year, with deployments at Amazon and GXO fulfillment centers.

name: Apptronik
description: Austin-based firm translating NASA legged research into modular workforce humanoids for industrial applications. Raised $935M total ($520M Series A extension Feb 2026) with partnerships including Mercedes-Benz, GXO, Jabil, and Amazon. New robot to debut in 2026.

name: Sanctuary AI
description: Canadian company combining Carbon AI cognition with humanoid embodiments for manufacturing and retail. Phoenix Gen 8 (Jan 2025) features wheeled base, 21-DOF hydraulic hands with 5mN tactile sensitivity. Partnerships with Microsoft, NVIDIA, and Magna International. $140M+ raised, 163 employees.

name: 1X Technologies
description: Norwegian-American startup backed by OpenAI building humanoids for home and industrial markets. NEO Gamma ($20K) consumer robot with World Model AI (Jan 2026) learns tasks from video. EVE industrial robot deployed for logistics. EQT partnership for 10,000 robots across 300+ portfolio companies. $126M+ raised, targeting 100K units/year production.

name: Fourier Intelligence
description: Shanghai-based rehab robotics leader expanding into general-purpose humanoids. GR-3 unveiled at CES 2026 with 53 DOF and Fourier N1 chip. GR-2 in mass production at 5,000 units/year for healthcare and automotive. Raised $193M+ total funding including $118M Series C (2024).

name: PAL Robotics
description: Barcelona-based robotics specialist (est. 2004) producing humanoids and mobile platforms for research, industry, and service. TALOS features 32-DOF torque-controlled manipulation. Launched KANGAROO bipedal platform at MWC 2026 targeting logistics. Partners with EU Horizon projects and major automotive manufacturers.

name: Engineered Arts
description: UK studio crafting expressive humanoids for entertainment, research, and customer engagement. Ameca Gen 3 ($100K-$500K) renowned for lifelike facial expressions using Mesmer technology. New Ami desktop companion for broader market. $16.2M raised including $10M Series A (Dec 2024).

name: Hanson Robotics
description: Hong Kong company renowned for social humanoids with realistic facial expressions and emotional intelligence. Created Sophia, the world's most famous humanoid robot granted Saudi Arabian citizenship.

name: Sony
description: Electronics giant with long-running Aibo consumer quadruped platform, pioneering consumer robot dogs since 1999. Offers the most sophisticated autonomous companion robot with AI personality development.

name: Xiaomi
description: Advanced robotics group extending AIoT expertise into humanoid (CyberOne) and quadruped (CyberDog) form factors. Open-source platform with NVIDIA Jetson Xavier NX and emotional detection capabilities.

name: SoftBank Robotics
description: Formerly Aldebaran Robotics. Filed bankruptcy Feb 2025, acquired by Maxvision Technology (China) for EUR 900K (July 2025). Pepper production halted 2021 (27K units made). NAO still available. New ownership plans eldercare, education, and security applications from Shenzhen operations.

name: Honda
description: Japanese pioneer of bipedal robotics investing in next-generation disaster-response avatars. Created foundational ASIMO which ushered in the modern humanoid robotics era before discontinuation in 2022.

name: Petoi
description: Maker community-focused company producing open-source palm-sized quadruped kits for education. Successfully raised $567K on Kickstarter, offering world's first affordable programmable robot dog starting at $225.

name: Swiss-Mile (RIVR)
description: ETH Zurich spin-off rebranded from Swiss-Mile to RIVR (Jan 2025). Wheeled-legged delivery robots (30+ kg payload, 30+ km range, 14 km/h). Partnerships with Just Eat Takeaway, Swiss Post, and Migros. Deploying in Milton Keynes UK (Feb 2026). $22M seed from Jeff Bezos and HongShan.

name: LimX Dynamics
description: Shenzhen robotics company developing humanoid (Oli, 165cm, 31 DOF), multi-modal (TRON 1/2), and wheeled quadruped (W1) robots. COSA agentic OS for autonomous real-world operation. $200M Series B (Feb 2026) from 16 investors including JD.com, NIO Capital, and SAIC Motor.

name: Weilan Technology
description: Nanjing-based consumer robot dog company. BabyAlpha A2 ($1,300) features GPT-4o integration, 360-degree LiDAR, 100+ expressions, and 40 biomimetic movements. Kickstarter campaign raised $277K. Focus on family companion and home monitoring applications.

name: XPeng Robotics
description: XPeng-backed enterprise merging autonomous driving tech with next-gen humanoid robots. IRON features 82+ DOF, 22-DOF hands, 720-degree Eagle-Eye vision, full solid-state batteries, and 2,250 TOPS compute (3 Turing AI chips). VLT Physical World Large Model. Mass production target end of 2026, 1M units by 2030.

name: NEURA Robotics
description: German company developing cognitive humanoid and quadruped robots with NVIDIA partnership. 4NE1 ($22K-$44.6K) priced for mass market, available June 2026. Raised €120M Series B (Jan 2025) led by Lingotto. 300+ employees, €1B order book, 10x revenue growth. Neuraverse platform with skill marketplace.

name: Elephant Robotics
description: Shenzhen robotics company with diverse product ecosystem: MarsCat ($1,199 bionic pet), myCobot series (collaborative arms), and Mercury humanoid platforms. CES 2026: myArm M750 dual-arm system and ultraArm P1. Focus on embodied AI, education, and professional robotics.

name: GALAXEA AI
description: GALAXEA AI is a Chinese robotics manufacturer specializing in humanoid robot development.

name: Leju Robotics
description: Leju Robotics is a Chinese robotics manufacturer specializing in humanoid robot development.

name: EngineAI
description: EngineAI is a Chinese robotics manufacturer specializing in humanoid robot development.

name: Shanghai Kepler Exploration Robotics
chineseName: 上海开普勒探索机器人有限公司
description: Shanghai Kepler Exploration Robotics is a Chinese robotics manufacturer specializing in humanoid robot development.

name: Astribot (Stardust Intelligence)
description: Astribot (Stardust Intelligence) is a Chinese robotics manufacturer specializing in humanoid robot development.

name: PaXini
description: PaXini is a Chinese robotics manufacturer specializing in humanoid robot development.

name: Shanghai Zhuoyide Robot (DroidUp)
chineseName: 上海卓益得机器人有限公司
description: Shanghai Zhuoyide Robot (DroidUp) is a Chinese robotics manufacturer specializing in humanoid robot development.

name: Noetix Robotics
description: Chinese humanoid robotics company developing DORA and Bumi platforms for industrial and service applications. Secured 1,000-unit Bumi orders for warehouse logistics. Bumi features 42 DOF with modular end-effectors and autonomous navigation for factory environments.

name: AgiBot
description: Shanghai-based robotics company developing advanced commercial humanoid and quadruped robots. Shipped 5,000 robots by January 2026 with a 39% global humanoid market share. Product lineup includes the A2 series (service/industrial humanoids), X2 (compact research humanoid), G2 (industrial humanoid), and D1 quadruped series. Debuted at CES 2026 for US market entry.

name: K-Scale Labs
description: Y Combinator-backed open-source humanoid robotics company that shut down in November 2025. Previously offered K-Bot ($9,000) and Z-Bot ($1,000) with Python SDK and Raspberry Pi-based computing. GitHub repos remain available but no longer actively maintained.

name: Mentee Robotics
description: Israeli robotics company developing AI-first vertically integrated humanoid robots with Real2Sim2Real technology. Being acquired by Mobileye for $900M, MenteeBot features advanced scene understanding, autonomous task execution, and proprietary actuators for real-world usefulness and adaptability.

name: VinMotion
description: Vietnamese robotics company and Vingroup subsidiary developing humanoid robots for service applications. Motion 2 features 24/7 autonomous operation with self-charging, 40kg payload capacity, and multilingual AI communication powered by Qualcomm processors.

name: Pollen Robotics
description: French robotics company acquired by Hugging Face, specializing in open-source humanoid robots for research and education. Reachy 2 features modular design, VR teleoperation, ROS2 integration, and serves as a platform for embodied AI experiments at top universities.

name: LG Electronics
description: Global electronics and appliance leader expanding into home robotics with AI-powered humanoid assistants. CLOiD humanoid integrates with LG ThinQ smart home ecosystem for Zero Labor Home vision, featuring dual articulated arms and vision-language AI for household chores.

name: SwitchBot
description: Smart home automation company pioneering home-service humanoid robots with vision-language-action AI. Onero H1 is designed for real-world household manipulation tasks like laundry folding and table clearing, featuring on-device AI processing and 22 degrees of freedom.

name: LEM Surgical
description: Swiss medical robotics company developing humanoid-style dual-arm surgical robot systems. Dynamis is FDA-cleared for spine and orthopedic procedures with bimanual manipulation, sub-millimeter accuracy, and 3D vision synchronized with surgical arm movements.

name: Dobot
description: Industrial and educational robotics manufacturer expanding into consumer quadruped robots. Rover X1 is a voice-controlled robot dog designed for home assistance and companionship, featuring hybrid wheel-leg design, auto-follow mode, and one of the most affordable price points in the category.

name: Diligent Robotics
description: Healthcare robotics company deploying autonomous mobile manipulator robots in hospitals. Founded by MIT and Georgia Tech social robotics experts, Moxi robots handle logistics tasks, completing over 1.25 million deliveries across 25+ U.S. hospitals. Acquired by Serve Robotics in January 2026.

name: Serve Robotics
description: Publicly traded sidewalk delivery robotics company with the largest autonomous delivery fleet in the U.S. Spun off from Postmates in 2021, deploys 2,000+ Level 4 autonomous robots for last-mile delivery with Uber Eats, DoorDash, and major retail partners. Targeting $1 per delivery cost at scale.

name: Andromeda Robotics
description: Australian robotics company building emotionally intelligent humanoid companions for aged care. Abi robot leverages ChatGPT-4, speaks 90+ languages, and combats loneliness in healthcare settings. Valued at $100M with $19.2M funding, deployed in Australian aged care facilities with U.S. expansion underway.

name: Fauna Robotics
description: NYC-based robotics company building humanoid robots that operate everywhere people do. Sprout is a safe, lightweight humanoid development platform with 29 DoF, NVIDIA Jetson AGX Orin compute, and soft exterior panels designed for unstructured environments.

name: August Robotics
description: Autonomous mobile robot company specializing in industrial floor operations. Creator of the Lionel robot platform for exhibition floor marking and construction drilling, with over 1 million marks recorded globally and deployed across exhibitions, construction sites, and industrial projects.

name: Geek+
description: World's largest warehouse fulfillment robotics provider, founded in 2015 and listed on HKEX (2590.HK). With 950+ employees and 56,000+ robots deployed across 40+ countries serving 800+ customers including UPS, Adidas, and Walmart. Pioneered the Gino 1 humanoid robot for warehouse operations powered by NVIDIA Jetson Thor.

name: RoboParty
description: Shanghai-based open-source humanoid robotics startup founded in April 2025 by 21-year-old Huang Yi. Backed by Xiaomi Strategic Investment, Matrix Partners China, and Galbot with a $10M seed round. Creator of ROBOTO ORIGIN, the world's first full-stack open-source bipedal humanoid robot with complete hardware and software stack on GitHub.

name: Faraday Future
description: EV and robotics company founded in 2014 by YT Jia, listed on NASDAQ (FFIE). Established FF EAI-Robotics Inc. in California to develop embodied AI robots. Launched three robot series at NADA Show 2026: FF Futurist humanoid, FF Master humanoid, and FX Aegis quadruped, with hardware sourced from AgiBot and custom FF software stack.
